member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ChildRecordCollectionSpacing
member.summary: An enumeration specifying the amount of empty rows used as padding around a set of child rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ChildRecordCollectionSpacing.None
member.summary: Specifies that no empty rows will be placed around a group of child records.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ChildRecordCollectionSpacing.SingleRow
member.summary: A single empty row will be placed above and below a child record collection.

member.summary: Throw exception if excel file limit is reached.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions
member.summary: A class defining a set of options that control various aspects of the Excel exporting process.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ChildRecordCollectionSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of empty rows used as padding around a set of child records. Defaults to a single row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.FileLimitBehaviour
member.summary: Specifies behavior during the exporting process. Use this if you want exporter to behave differently when it reaches one of excel file limits.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeExpandedState
member.summary: Determines if each record's IsExpanded state is honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy over each 's state from the being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeFieldLayoutSettings
member.summary: Determines if the FieldLayoutSettings of the DataPresenter are honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy the from the being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeFieldSettings
member.summary: Determines if the FieldSettings of the DataPresenter are honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy the from the being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeGroupBySettings
member.summary: Determines if the groupby settings of the DataPresenter are honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy the groupby settings from the being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeRecordFilters
member.summary: Determines if record filter criteria of the DataPresenter is honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy over the record filter criteria from the being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeRecordVisibility
member.summary: Determines if each record's Visibility setting of the DataPresenter is honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy over each 's property setting from the being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeSortOrder
member.summary: Determines if the sorted fields of the DataPresenter are honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy the from the associated being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.ExportOptions.ExcludeSummaries
member.summary: Determines if the summary settings of the DataPresenter are honored during the exporting process.

remarks.p: If set to true this means that we don't want to copy the summary settings of the associated being exported. Default value is false.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.Clone
member.summary: Returns a copy of the object.
member.returns: A copy of the current object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the borders around the cells of a field.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of all of the borders. Individual border settings take precedence.

remarks.p: If the border style is set to a non-default value and the is default (Color.Empty), it will be resolved to Color.Black.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.BottomBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom border color.

remarks.p: If the border color is set to a non-default value and the is set to Default, it will be resolved to Thin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.BottomBorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom border style.

remarks.p: If the border style is set to a non-default value and the is default (Color.Empty), it will be resolved to Color.Black.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FillPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill pattern in the cell.

remarks.p: If fill pattern is set to Solid, the cell is filled using just the . For all other patterns, both FillPatternForegroundColor and are used.

member.value: The fill pattern in the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FillPatternBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of a field.
member.remarks: If the background color is set to a non-default value and the is set to Default, the resolved fill pattern style is Gray50percent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FillPatternForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the cells in a field.
member.remarks: If the foreground color is set to a non-default value and the is set to Default, the resolved fill pattern style is Solid. There, a solid cell color can easily be applied by setting only the FillPatternForegroundColor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the font.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the font family of the object being exported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the font for the object being exported, in device-independent units.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontStrikeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether the font is struck out.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the font for the object being exported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontSuperscriptSubscriptStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the underline style of the font.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontUnderlineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the underline style of the font.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight of the font for the object being exported.

remarks.p: Note: Since Excel does not have full support for all of the various options of font weights, the values will be converted to the closest match that Excel supports.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.FormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the Excel-style number format string.

remarks.p: For more information on excel format strings, consult Microsoft Excel help.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the content in a cell.
member.value: The horizontal alignment of the content in a cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent in units of average character widths.
member.exception: The assigned value is outside the valid indent level range of 0 and 15.
member.value: The indent in units of average character widths.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.LeftBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the left border color.

remarks.p: If the border color is set to a non-default value and the is set to Default, it will be resolved to Thin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.LeftBorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the left border style.

remarks.p: If the border style is set to a non-default value and the is default (Color.Empty), it will be resolved to Color.Black.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

remarks.p: The Locked valid is used in Excel file only if the associated or is protected. Otherwise the value is ignored.

member.value: The valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.RightBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the right border color.

remarks.p: If the border color is set to a non-default value and the is set to Default, it will be resolved to Thin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.RightBorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the right border style.

remarks.p: If the border style is set to a non-default value and the is default (Color.Empty), it will be resolved to Color.Black.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the cell content in degrees.

remarks.p: Cell text rotation, in degrees; 0 90 is up 0 90 degrees, 91 180 is down 1 90 degrees, and 255 is vertical.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

remarks.p: If True, the size of the cell font will shrink so all data fits within the cell.

member.value: The value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.TopBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the top border color.

remarks.p: If the border color is set to a non-default value and the is set to Default, it will be resolved to Thin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.TopBorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the top border style.

remarks.p: If the border style is set to a non-default value and the is default (Color.Empty), it will be resolved to Color.Black.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the content in a cell.
member.value: The vertical alignment of the content in a cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.FormatSettings.WrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

remarks.p: If True, and the row associated with the cell has a default , the row's height will automatically be increased to fit wrapped content.

member.value: The value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.Resources
member.summary: Exposes a instance for this assembly.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.Resources.GetString(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns the resource string using the specified name and default culture.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.CancelExport(Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.DataPresenterBase)
member.summary: Cancels any asynchronous export operations for the specified that were initiated by this instance.

remarks.p: An export operation may be cancelled by handling the event and setting the to true. However, for an asynchronous export the operation may be pending while another asynchronous operation is pending or the export may still be preparing the source control. For those situations this method may be used to cancel the operation.

member.param: The datapresenter whose asynchronous export is to be cancelled

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.AsyncExportDuration
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of time that should be spent processing the export each time the elapses.
member.exception: The TimeSpan must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.AsyncExportInterval
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of time to wait after performing an asynchronous export for the amount of time specified by the .
member.exception: The TimeSpan must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.IsExporting
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating if the exporter is in the process of an export operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.ShowAsyncExportStatus
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that indicates whether a control containing the export status is displayed to the end user while an asynchronous export is in progress.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.BeginExport
member.summary: Occurs at the beginning of the export process. The data presenter has been initialized but the data source has not yet been set.

remarks.p: The DataPresenter argument returns a reference to the cloned object that is about to be exported.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired before all other events. You can use it to do any preprocessing before exporting process starts, such as writing a custom header to the Excel workbook.
Note: The BeginExport event has been deprecated. The event should be used instead.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.InitializeRecord
member.summary: Occurs when a record is initialized.

remarks.p: The Record argument returns a reference to the record that is being exported.
The SkipRecord argument specifies whether to skip the current record. This argument doesn't affect exporting of descendant records.
The SkipDescendants argument specifies whether to skip the descendats of the current record.
The SkipSiblings argument specifies whether to skip sibling rows of the current record.
The TerminateExport argument specifies whether to terminate the export process. The current record will not be processed.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired for every record that is being exported, and before and are fired. Use this event to set record-specific properties and to control the exporting process.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.RecordExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a record is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Record argument returns a reference to record being exported.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired before the Excel row is processed. Use Cancel argument to cancel row exporting. If the records span multiple rows, this event is fired only for the first row.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.RecordExported
member.summary: Occurs after a record is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Record argument returns a reference to the record being exported.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired after the Excel row is processed. Use it to apply any additional formatting to Excel row. If the records span multiple rows, this event is fired only for the last row..

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.SummaryRowExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a summary row is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Summaries argument returns a reference to summary values.
The SummaryLevel argument returns a current summary level.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired before Excel row with summary values for specific level is processed. Use the Cancel argument to cancel row exporting. If summaries span multiple Excel rows, this event is fired only for first row of summaries.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.SummaryRowExported
member.summary: Occurs after summary record is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Summaries argument returns a reference to summary values.
The SummaryLevel argument returns a current summary level.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired after Excel row with summary values for specific level is processed. Use it to apply any additional formatting to Excel row. If summaries span multiple Excel rows, this event is fired only for last row of summaries.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.HeaderAreaExporting
member.summary: Occurs before header area is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The FieldLayout argument returns a reference the layout object associated with the headers.
The Record argument returns a reference to the first record associated with the headers.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired before Excel row with header values is processed. Use Cancel argument to cancel row exporting. If headers span multiple Excel rows, this event is fired only for first header row.
This event is not fired when the labels are displayed with the cells instead of in a separate header area.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.HeaderAreaExported
member.summary: Occurs after header area is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The FieldLayout argument returns a reference the layout object associated with the headers.
The Record argument returns a reference to the first record associated with the headers.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .

This event is fired after Excel row with header values is processed. Use it to apply any additional formatting to Excel row. If headers span multiple Excel rows, this event is fired only for last header row.
This event is not fired when the labels are displayed with the cells instead of in a separate header area.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.CellExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a cell is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Field argument returns a reference to the associated field.
The Record argument returns a reference to the record containing the cell.
The Value argument returns the value of the cell.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
Use the Cancel argument to cancel cell exporting.

member.summary: Occurs after a cell is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Field argument returns a reference to the associated field.
The Record argument returns a reference to the record containing the cell.
The Value argument returns the value of the cell.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
Use this event to apply any additional formatting to Excel cell after the cell has been exported.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.HeaderLabelExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a header label is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Field argument returns a reference to the associated field.
The Label argument allows control over what value should be shown in the header cell.
The Record argument returns a reference to the first record associated with the headers.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
Use the Cancel argument to cancel the exporting of this cell.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.HeaderLabelExported

The Record argument returns a reference to the first record associated with the headers.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
Use this event to apply any additional formatting to Excel cell.

The SummaryLevel argument returns a current summary level.
Additionaly this event has Cancel, Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
Use the Cancel argument to cancel the exporting of the summary cell.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.SummaryCellExported
member.summary: Occurs after a summary cell is exported to Excel.

remarks.p: The Summary argument returns a reference to a summary value.
The SummaryLevel argument returns current summary level.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
Use this event to apply any additional formatting to a summary cell.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.EndExport
member.summary: Occurs after the exporting process is finished.

remarks.p: The Canceled argument is true if exporting process was been canceled.
This event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired after exporting process is finished.

Note: The EndExport event has been deprecated. The or event should be used instead. The direct replacement for this event is the ExportEnding but if you used an overload of Export that saved to a file then you should use the to show the file since the file will not be saved until after the ExportEnding has been raised.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.ExportStarted
member.summary: Occurs after the export process has started. The data presenter has been initialized but the data source has not yet been set.

remarks.p: The DataPresenter argument returns a reference to the cloned object that is about to be exported.
Additionaly this event has Workbook, CurrentWorksheet, CurrentRowIndex, CurrentColumnIndex, CurrentOutlineLevel arguments inherited from .
This event is fired before all other events. You can use it to do any preprocessing before exporting process starts, such as writing a custom header to the Excel workbook.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.ExportEnding
member.summary: Invoked after the export process is complete but before the contents are saved to a file.

remarks.p: The ExportEnding event is invoked when the export process has completed to give the developer one final opportunity to manipulate the Workbook being generated. This is particularly important when using an overload of the Export method that takes a filename as the file will be saved after the ExportEnding is complete but before the so any changes to the Workbook in the ExportEnded will not be reflected in the saved file. Also, since the file will not have been created until after the ExportEnding, if you wanted to copy the file to another location or display the file to the end user, the ExportEnded event should be used to do that.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Windows.DataPresenter.ExcelExporter.DataPresenterExcelExporter.ExportEnded
member.summary: Occurs after the export process has completed.

remarks.p: The ExportEnded event is raised after the export process has been completed. If an overload of the Export method that accepts a filename was used, then the file would be available at this point since the file is saved after the event has been completed but before the ExportEnded. Therefore any manipulations of the Workbook should be done in the event or else those changes will not be reflected in the saved file.
